"Do you just have the one kid? This is my first."

"My wife want to start trying now. Seems like so much is happening quickly."

"We want to have at least 6 kids. We are from Italy, and we love having big families!"

"I do not see my mom much, but I have a great relationship with my dad."

yeah.take him running with you.how much do you run and how far usually?

column3:
"I'm a thrill seaker. Do you like extreme sports?"
"I usually don't. But this one was very impressive."

"What do you like most about it?"
"I really like just being able to escape to a different world."

"Yeah, like everything fades away. Do you ever watch the olympics?"
"I usually don't, but I do enjoy watching it during the summer Olympics!"

"What is your favorite olympic sport?"
"I like swimming. What's yours?"

"Summer sport would be skateboarding, and winter would be ice cross."
"That's cool. What got you into watching sports?"

"Acess to the tv, lol. Just kidding. I love to participate so watching was a way to learn more about the sports I like. What about you."
"Mostly just lack of anything else to do around here, and all my friends were into sports at the time"

Do you have kids of your own?
I don't we are waiting to pay off the house before we have kids. What about you?
We have two boys.

'My phone died and I could not find the charger for my phone so I wanted to get a newspaper.'
'So you normally view the newspaper on your phone?'

'I usually do it is just the most convenient place for me to get caught up with the news.'
'I prefer to read a newspaper. I guess I am old school like that. '

'Why do you like getting news from a newspaper more?'
'I find it easier to read words printed in ink. Plus I can clean windows with the newspaper when I am done reading it!'

'Yeah sometimes my eyes start to hurt after looking at a screen too long.'
'Yeah. Do you ever use the blue light filter feature on your devices? '

'No what is that?'
'It filters out blue light from your electronic devices. This keeps your eyes from straining while viewing your device. '

'I will definitely look into that because I work a lot on my computer.'
'I know Galaxy phones have the feature built in and it works great!'

column3:
"I'm really sorry to hear that. Losing two family members in such a short timespan is really heartbreaking. "
"its really heart breaking. i'm so glad to have made good memories. it would be tragic if i had regrets"

"I completely agree. It makes you realize how important it is to spend time with people while they are here."
"Absolutely, it's a chapter of your life and as long as you have those memories they live on through those memories."

"That is a really good way of looking at it. And you can share those memories with new people in your life and breathe life into them."
"You are so right. It can make all the difference."

"Do you have other family members to help you after your loss?"
"yeah we have a large close knit family. how bout you?"

"We keep in touch, but all my immediate family lives rather far. So it is just me and my dogs at home."
"same here . i just know a lot of people that actually is going through it ."

"It is really hard to watch people go through it, whether they decide to get treatment or just accept it."
"so how do you feel about cancer..."

column3:
"It's amazing how a little kindness from strangers can go such a long way."
"He thought I was cute and old fashioned since I wore a locket. I still love to line dry my clothes! Nothing better, I say!"
"I agree with you! The way linens smell after being air dried is way better than any dryer sheet"
"A word of advice, always hang your clothes higher than your goats can reach! I learned that early on living on a homestead! Explains the missing socks!"
"Oh wow yeah! I never thought about that. I don't raise animals but my neighbor does. I do like to hunt deer from time to time."
"We've had so many animals but their all for slaughter or use on the farm, chickens for eggs, goats for milk, ya know.... we hunt a lot as well."
"That's great. I love animals, but I also love the thrill of the hunt. I use a bow to make it more interesting."
"Wow! A bow! You're a true hunter! Ya know, all these animals I've owned but I've never had a true indoor pet?"
"Really? Man, pets are great too. I am lost without my dog."
"I'll one day own a ferret. I've been selling our extra eggs at the market to save up for one!"
"Keep at it! Ferrets are cute little things. Where would you put it?"
"I'd cage it at night but take it with me during the day. Ferrets are canines so you can train them like dogs."

"I'm sorry to hear that.  Why are you insecure?"
"I am not insecure."
"Which do you prefer, selling houses or waitressing?"
"I like selling houses more because I don't have to interact with lots of people."
"You prefer the one on one relationships.  I can understand that.  Have you been selling houses a long time?"
"Exactly. I have been selling houses since I was 12 years old!"
"Really!  That is impressive.  What kinds of houses?"
"mostly larger houses that celebrities buy. I sold one once for $10 million."
"How were you able to sell houses when you ere 12?"
"Well it wasn't just me, my parents helped me through the process. But my name was on the sign!"
"That's impressive.  How many years have you been selling houses?"
"Well I'm 100 now so about 88 years!"
"I think you are Joking but it's been fun chatting"
"I was hehe. great chatting with you"

"Shpongle is a weird group. I think they are touring this winter."

"Great. What are you doing today?"
"It is just starting to get cold, so I am going to put the roof on my Jeep Wrangler."

"That's a good idea, I should start preparing for winter as well."
"Yeah. This summer was so hot!!!!!!!!! I am hoping for a chilly fall and frigid winter!!!"

"I agree! I'm excited to see what winter brings into the area."
"I'm sure we are going to get pounded with snow. Gotta watch out for the black ice!!!"

"Yes! I'd better get to the store soon to pick up some salt. When do you guys normally start seeing snow around here?"
"Usually in December but with climate change we could get a November blizzard!"

"Yes. I can't believe he would do this knowing what I'm going through with the divorce!"
"Yeah, well, my big brother once hit me in the head with the claw end of a hammer."

"What a jerk! If I was there I could've helped you, since I'm in my second year of medical school."
"Ha-ha.  Yeah, no doubt.  I was just a kid and kind of indestructible.  We fought a lot."

"That's very unfortunate. I hope my two kids never fight that way. Are you on good terms with your brother now?"
"We are great friends now.  I don't get to see him so much since I'm on tour with my band."

"I'm happy to hear that, I hope you get to seem him soon. Maybe he can come to see one of your shows."
"Yeah, he's been to a few.  I was hoping we could do X-mas with the whole family.  Maybe next year."

"I don't know how Christmas is gonna go with my family this year either... it's hard to be divorced when there's two kids mixed in."
"Divorce is the WORST.  I, too, am divorced.  Worst experience of my life.  I don't speak to my ex."

"I'm sorry to hear that. It's very hard. I'm just ready to be done with the process."
"It will get better over time.  Focus on your kids if you can.  It's gotta be rough.  Oh and get another partner!"

"Oh, that's the same year my son was born.  Do you have kids?"
"Yes I have 3 and big kid (husband)."

"Ha that's funny.  Some men never grow up."
"Yes do your kids still live at home?"

"No my kids are grown and have moved out.  Its kind of quiet sometimes but I like to get out and hike."
"Yes it is nice when they are independent, I didnt think I would adjust as well as I am."

"Do they live close enough to see them when you want?"
"Real close!  With me, LOL ;-) But they are in college and busy with work and school."

"Oh that's an exciting time.  Two of my 3 live nearby but my oldest is 1800 miles away on the west coast"
"My oldest is talking of a move to California, how do feel about the distance with a child?"

"Well it is difficult but you just have to make time to go see them.  He lives in a gorgeous area and I can hike alot there."
"Yes it is nice to have a common interest and that you enjoy vacation there.  Any grandkids yet?"

"yes 4 grandkids and that is very fun.  Be wary of California with all the wildfires"
"I KNOW!  We visited LA last November and brought masks"

"It's unfortunate.  My son is in Oregon and they struggle all summer long"
"Oh gosh, the smoke is there too?  I didnt know that."

A caregiver is someone who takes care of people who cannot ordinarily take care of themselves.
I did a little bit of that when I was in college.  I took care of a few autistic adults.  It was emotional.

That must have been an interesting experience. I've read about adults with autism, it sounds quite difficult. What did you learn from the experience?
One thing was how big their personalities could be.  My guy was hilarious.  He told great jokes!

That's very interesting. What did you go into after college?
I went to work in Silicon Valley for a semiconductor company.  I should have tried out for Dancing with the Stars!

That sounds like a cool job. I dropped out of high school, and a few years later started a small business with my dad.

"I can't wait for the Washington Nationals parade to celebrate their World Series win."
"I am also eagerly waiting for the moment"

"What a great series.  I was biting my nails the entire time.  I thought Houston was going to pull it out."
"That nice .You seems very eager to this.isn't it?"

"Yeah.  I like having baseball on in the background while I work.  I also love the stats.  Fun!"
"I hope the home team wins."

"I cheer for the home team usually, too.  Unless of course, the home team is the Yankees."
"I love the Yankees."

"Are you from New York?"
"Yes, I am one of the 325 million people who live in the United States."

"Oh, we've got that many people now?  Wow.  It sure is getting crowded."
"Sure is."

"I like fish too. But really I am not picky. Do you eat a lot of fish?"
"I eat pretty much only fish. My parents do too, and they're both over 6 feet. Probably cause of the fish LOL"
"Possibly. How do you like to prepare your fish?"
"I LOVE salmon. Sear it with some rosemary, lots of butter, and some lemon. to DIE FOR."
"That sounds wonderful - what do you like for side dishes? I eat lots of veggies"
"Some shittake mushrooms and asparagus stirfried with olive oil - I'm a big keto fan so it suits fish"
"I like the way you think - and EAT! Sounds very healthy"
"I'm just worried about where I get my fish - sometime i get scared about mercury and other toxins"
"Yes, I have that worry too - you can never be sure, can you?"
"It's why I pay extra for wild salmon and organic stuff - call me a health nut but when I'm 95 who's laughing? LOL"
"95? That's amazing. Maybe you should write a book"

"That's awesome! Family traditions are the best! Did you do anything for Halloween? It was an excuse to eat chocolate for me."

"I bought a lot of candy to hand out, but not many kids showed up! So now I'm stuck with a lot of chocolate, and way too much candy!"
"Hey, that sounds like a win to me! More candy for you! What do you like to do for fun?"

"I play for my college's basketball team. Between that and my studies, I don't have much free time. What about you?"
"That sounds fun! I'm pretty busy with studies too but i like to geocache with my boyfriend. What do you study? "

"That's really cool. I'm studying education, hoping to become a teacher. What are your career ambitions?"
"Cool! My boyfriend is in education as well and is on his first placement. I'm in my senior year of psychiatric nursing. Are you enjoying it?"

"Very interesting. I am enjoying it, yes. I'm a bit nervous about entering the job market though. Congrats to your boyfriend! What got you interested in psychiatric nursing?"
"Well we always need new amazing teachers so I'm sure you'll be fine. I was very interested in both nursing and pscyhology and that's psych nursing!"

"Thank you. It sounds like you've found the perfect career fit!"
"You too! I'm sure you will make a fabulous teacher and I wish you the best!"

column3:
"I'm trying to lose weight for my upcoming skiing competition! Do you do any sports? "
"Not, really. I just go to work in bicycle sometimes."

"That's awesome! Great for both you and the environment! Where do you work?"
"I take care of kids at a family house. It is about 20 minutes in bicycle. "

'That sounds like an awesome job! I love kids. Do you have any of your own or want any in the future?'
'I don´t  have any kids yet. But I want to some day. Do you have kids?'

"Yeah I have two kids! A one year old boy and a 3 year old girl. No regrets! What do you like to do for fun?"
"Those are great ages! I love outdoor activities in my big yard. I like BBQ and playing cards or just chilling in summer."

"Oh man that sounds so nice! I'm looking out my window at the snow and missing summer. Do you live somewhere hot or do you get snow too?"
"I get a lot of snow, Which I find interesting too, but also miss summer. Where do you live?"

'I live in Canada. I hate the cold, its unbearable! Where do you live? '
"Ohh. Haven´t you thought about moving? I live in West Virginia, USA."

'Wow Congrats! I recently got a job as a radio host! I love it.'

"Interesting! what time of day do you work? "
"Usually early mornings because that's when people are commuting to work. What about you?"

"that's the only time of day I listen to the radio! My hours are regular office hours. I am really enjoying my new gig. sounds like you are too? "
'Ahh so the typical 9-5? My husband is the same, but he usually works overtime by having to go to corporate dinners haha. Yeah I love it.'

'Yep exactly. Do you get lots of people calling in to your show? '
'Not usually, people only really call in for the competitions we run. '

"ah ha. I've actually called in and won on radio shows before! do you get decent vacation time? "
"Really?! What did you win? Yeah, it's the standard amount you'd expect really, but every day feels like a holiday when you love your job :)"

"I totally agree! You gotta do what you love, find the right mix of people! I've won concert tickets!"
'Wow really? To see who? I recently went to see BTS live, that was absolutely amazing. I love any type of pop music haha.'

"that's true. in theory the numbers work, but you can only know for sure once the solar panels are installed."
"I'd love to have the panels but math isn't my strong point."
'maybe a qualified electrician in the field can help you crunch the numbers.'
"that would be most good."
"now, i need your advice. my mom is allergic to dogs and i've got two dogs as pets. how can i make my home inviting for mom?"
"Can the dogs be put in another room when she visits?"
'i do that already, though she still gets symptoms. maybe i can use solar power to power a uv allergen zapper.'
"Now that's a new idea! I love it."
'since we both would like to install panels, I think we should arrange for the same company to do the work.'
"Do you know anyone who's had it done? Someone who could offer recommendation?"
"Yes, my brother had his whole house off grid with Green Solars Energy. Great company and affordable."

"I listen to blues, mostly. I've been collecting blues years." 
"That's cool! Do you have any band reccomendations? I'm always looking for things to add to my spotify playlist."

"I definitely recommend checking out the work of B.B. King. Ever listened to him?" 
"Nope. I've honestly never heard of him. I'm looking him up right now. What else do you like to do for fun?"

"I like playing instruments. My friends and I recently started a garage band, that's been a lot of fun. What about you?" 
"That's so cool! What kind of music do you play? I like hanging out with my dog and playing video games."

"Nice, what kinds of video games? I like video games too. My band and I mostly play classic rock. I'm on the bass guitar." 
"All of them! Right now I'm playing through Borderlands 3. It's a lot of fun! That's super cool. Do you perform ever or just play for fun?"

"Borderlands 3, very cool.I was thinking of trying it. What character are you playing? And yeah, we mostly play weddings, honestly!" 
"I'm playing as FL4K! It's really buggy right now but its still awesome. That's super cool. Maybe I'll hire you to play mine one day!"

"Nice, I was of playing FL4K too. I'm mostly absorbed by the new Modern Warfare lately though, haha. And that would be cool! Do you have a partner?" 
"What system do you play on? Yeah I have a boyfriend of almost 3 years. Do you have a partner? What country are you in?"

"I play on ps4. And cool! I got out a relationship about a month ago. I'm from Canada. And you?" 
"Oh no sorry to hear that! We have a ps4, xbox one, and switch between the two of us! I'm also in Canada - Manitoba."

"My job is a total deadend. Selling things no one wants. Literally the only good thing is that it's 9-5 w/no overtime"

"I do, but I don't like feeling like I'm trying to scam people when selling them stuff...so I need to look for a new gig"
"Well as a bank teller you don't scam people"

"right - maybe I should try that! do you need to have experience? "
"Most teller jobs need experience with handling cash and a high school diploma. so you would have to have some expirience in the field"

"ok I've done multiple retail jobs and I am def a hs graduate, plus I'm sick of sales. I'll look for openings"
"well now most provide on-the-job training.so you will get all the training you need there"

"sounds perfect! my other alternative would be working at Costco...after all, it's my favorite place to shop!"
"I love going to Costco."

"Me too! I need to head over there and check out some of their stuff for Christmas!"
"You should - it has something for everyone."

"Ah, I hope you enjoy your time not working. How long will you be on bed rest for?"

"Do they not have enough security staff available so that you can help customers?"

column3:
"I do, but not much anymore. Do you?"
"I used to have a dirt bike, but don't anymore either. Some of my family ride in groups and events."
"Why did you stop cycling?"
"Mountain biking accident. Couldn't afford to replace my bike afterwards."
"Oh no! That's awful. Did you get hurt in the accident?"
" Only my pride was hurt. I have a friend who does some tests to show riding skills and I tried to copy her. It didn't work out so well."
"Oof! What a bummer. Hopefully your pride has recovered since then. :)"
"Mostly recovered. I don't think I'll be trying to show off like that again, though!"
"I don't blame you one bit. Do you have any other hobbies to take its place?"
"I take time on the weekends to hike up in Canada. The views up there are great."
"Oh wow. I've never been, but I'd like to go one day. Friends who have traveled there absolutely love it."
"Yeah you should go! Or to any lake/camping area near where you live. You would have a great time too!"

column3:
"Well, my mother might be some that believes that... she has 500 pairs of shoes for crying out loud!"
"Oh wow. What does she say she wants with all those shoes?"

"She just tells me that she can't give them up because he thinks that something awful will happen to me if she does."
"Are they her shoes, or did they used to be yours? That seems a little odd!"

"They're shoes that she sees and buys. There are some that used to be mine or my fathers but most are just shoes that she sees at stores."
"Huh, interesting. But she thinks something bad will happen to you if she gives up the shoes? Bad like what?"

"I'm allergic to a lot of different things like shellfish, cats, etc. So something like I'll get scratched by a cat and die. Who knows!"
"Well, I guess moms will mom as they want! Hahaha. Is her house really cluttered with all those shoes?"

"No, I have "left the nest" as they say. My father and mother both live in the town I grew up in."
"Good for you. :) Life happened to me in a pretty rough way, so I'm currently in my folks' basement...but it's a place!"

"Hey at least you have your family close by! What happened if you don't mind me asking?"
"My roommate committed suicide two years ago, and I couldn't make the bills without her. But my parents let me save money, so I'm glad for them."

column3:
"I didn't realize dentistry went back that far?"
Yup! In fact I have heard archaeologists have discovered mummified ancients with metal bands wrapped around individual teeth

"I wonder how they were able to do that fine of metalwork thousands of years ago?"
Beats me... the only reason I know this is because I've been doing a lot of research in hopes I can convince my mom that I shouldn't get braces.

"LOL! I didn't get braces when I was a kid, but I should have. You may not like them now, but it will definitely be worth it years later."
Yes, but I suppose it's worth it in the long run.  But I hate the idea of having metal in my mouth.

"There are new braces that are clear plastic that you wear at night, they make new ones as your teeth get realigned"
I wonder if those would also help stop food getting between your teeth.

"They might as they cover the teeth, but you mostly wear them while you are sleeping."
I didn't know if you wore them during the day while you. I tend to be eating all the time. I probably need to stop eating so much.

"Friends that had regular braces did have to watch a lot of what they ate and had to cut some things out."
I don't think my mom would let me get the clear braces you're talking about. Probably just to embarrass me.

是的，牙套通常是在睡觉时佩戴，以减少对牙齿的压力。

比如，如果牙套是金属的，可能会被某些食物染色，比如黑咖啡、可乐、茶、红葡萄酒等。此外，酸性食物可能会腐蚀牙套，所以要避免吃太多酸性食物，比如柠檬

"I'd say get a good cooking book or search up simple recipes on youtube."

"I'm on a tight budget so I guess I'll like at videos on youtube. Any good recipes you would recommend? "
'Fair enough, I can relate as a student haha. I really like asian food, anything with rice. So maybe fried rice is a good start.'

"Thanks, that's a really good idea. It's pretty cheap and I can almost whatever meats I want to it."
'yeah exactly, and it's good to use up vegetables that are about to go bad too.'

"That would be true if I ate vegetables haha. I really need to start eating healthier.  "
"Same here, I need to join the gym too. If only it wasn't so expensive :("

"There's plenty of cardio exercises you can do at home that don't take long."
"It's difficult to exercise in my house because I live in university accommodation and my room is super small unfortunately."

"I didn't know professors could live on campus. Well you could try the campus gym."
"The university provides me accommodation for a reasonable price. We get discounts for the gym it's still quite expensive. I might take up running instead."

"I think it's more economic too"
"Yes and no. While many people save money from not buying meat, supplementing the vitamins and protein meat gives you can be expensive."

"I don't think you need to take supplements as a vegetarian. Have you ever tried skipping meat?"
"There are some things you can't get from vegetables alone. I might consider going vegetarian, it's just skipping meat."

"It might not be easy at first but there are many interesting veggie options out there."
"What interests me is veggie versions of meat products. I really want to try the impossible whopper."

"I've never tried that one but it sounds yummy"
"I've heard good things about it. I love the taste of meat so I am really interested in things like that, would make going vegetarian easier."

"For sure. Going vegetarian is so much easier than vegan. I couldn't leave without cheese!"
"I agree, I would give up if I couldn't have any cheese."

"Me too! And what do you think about gluten-free diet?"
"Well, I don't think it's necessary if you don't have a gluten allergy or celiac's disease. I've heard it can lower blood sugar for diabetics though."

"I had it for 4 years. I was given it by my older sister for my birthday. It's a sad day... Do you have any pets?"
"Yeah I have one dog called cody."
"Aw, that's cute name for a dog. And how long have you had him?"
"for three years this winter. We got him for the kids but it turns out I needed him more than them when they left for university haha."
"Kids move on very quickly when they go to university, but it's great that Cody can keep you company! After 3 years, he must be like family now"
"He definitly is! He's my baby now, along with the children I teach at school :) What od"
"You're a teacher? And what do you teach? :) I don't know if I would be able to become a teacher haha"
"I teach year two students, so it's not that difficult because they're just learning to count haha. You could! It's not difficult, you just need patience :)"
"Ahh, year two students definitely don't sound as bad as year 9 haha! But that's the thing, patience is necessary, and it's exhausting!"
"It is exhausting! But at least I get a lot of holiday time to recover haha! Do you have a job?"
"And are summer and winter holidays paid at all? Cause that's how long all together 4-5months?  But no, I'm currently at university :)"
"Ohhh that's interesting, what do you study? I loved university so much. Yes there's good holiday pay thankfully :)"
"I study politics and international relations, definitely an exciting degree in today's world haha :)"
"Wow for sure! I'm in England so Brexit has been all over the news every day haha. Anyway I wish you luck with it!! :)"

"Yeah, I play guitar mainly. I want to be a music teacher! What's your favorite piece to play?"
"Why a music teacher and not a performer? But my favourite piece, hm, I played flamenco guitar - so 'asturias', such a good piece"
"I do perform, mostly on weekends, but I really enjoy working with new people who are keen to learn! Figured I could make a more reliable career out of it."

"Mice aren't as bad as everyone thinks they are."
"I've got a fear of rodents, I don't like them in general. But why do you think that mice aren't as bad?"

"They help keep other pests like insects away"
"Okay, I agree here. To keep the biodiversity, mice are necessary. But keeping them as pets isn't the necessary"

"That's true its not, mine are kids to me. We watch Dr.Who together."
"You watch Dr.Who with mice? Haha, interesting. And have you read Dr.Who books?"

"I can't have books, the mice eat the pages."
"That's a shame. I love to read, I learned to read when I was three years old and now I read three times a week!"

"Reading is a fun way to take an adventure, before I got my mice I would read. What are your favorite types of books?"
"I love reading academic books and books about history! Books about Chinese, Russian and French history are fascinating!"

"Do you know how to speak those languages?"
"Sadly, I can only read about Chinese history in English, but I can speak the other languages. They are so fun!"

"Bacon should be, and if you think about it, it's meat candy. It's so versatile as well."
"I've never thought of it like that but it is. My favorite is using bacon with veggies, makes them taste better."
"Agreed, bacon with green beans is a great side dish."
"I like to wrap it around asparagus topped with cheese."
"Now that sounds really good! I may have to try that some time. Have you ever used bacon mixed with ground beef for a burger?"
"Yes I have I add peppers into the mix as well to give it a kick."
"Good trick, what type of bacon do you normally use? I prefer peppered bacon or thick cut."
"I like applewood smoked."
"That's a good type too, perfect on a BLT"
"Yes it is, or I crumbled it and make bacon cheeseburger eggrolls. Which is so delicious."
"that sounds pretty good, I'll have to try that later!"
"I think Bacon should be it's own food group."

"It's so hot there! I don't know how anyone could live there in the summer."
"Agreed! Hot and humid... and rainy! I like to see the seasons, especially winter! My favorite!"

"I wen't to Disney World with my kids during vacation once. It rained for almost 5 days!"
"Oh no!! That is bad! I hope that did not ruin your vacation."

"I had to wait in line for hours in the rain. It has horrible."
"I hope the kids did not get a cold!"

"They didn't, thank god. Could have been way worse I guess."
"Yeah! I usually take vitamin c all the time just to prevent colds. You should do the same with the kids! Thank god no cold after all that rain."

"Thanks for the tip! Does vitamin C really prevent colds?"
"Yeah! and Zinc! It helps prevent them but it does not make much of a difference once you have it."

"Do you think they will ever find a cure for the cold? It's so annoying."
"It mutates a lot! I hope that they will at some point. We have to be careful with all these mutations though."

column3:
"Yeah, I haven't lost a parent yet, so I don't know what to do or say to her."
"Well, I have lost a grandparent as well, and most of the time you don't need to say anything - just be there."

"That's what I've been doing, her family is all coming in, so I've been cleaning and getting food and stuff in"
"That's a good way to be supportive - anything to help her - especially to allow her more time with her family.  Does she like to draw?"

"Yeah, she does. But I'm a truck driver so I have to leave for a few days too. So hopefully her family will be here to help."
"I would make sure that she has family for support and isn't alone.  Drawing is a good coping outlet for me - I draw my feelings and it helps"

"Do you suggest I get her a journal and pencils?"
"A drawing journal would be good so she could draw and write out her feelings.  Gives her a healthy way to release them"

"Yeah! I think thats great! Even one of those that have prompts for her to write or draw."
"Yeah that's true, what does she usually like to draw?  You might encourage her to draw something she likes also to make her happy."

"She likes to draw animals."
"I always liked drawing animals too - I used to go to the zoo and sit and draw the animals."

column3:
"I would like to start going to the gym to help me lose some weight, but it's hard to get motivated? Any suggestions? "
"Hi I'm Ray. I am a physical fitness enthusiast. I believe eating healthy and exercising is a important."

"I think exorcise would really help me. What do you use to keep yourself motivated? "
"I am very conscious of my weight, so that is one motivator. Also, I feel mentally better when I exercise. That alone is motivation."

"That's a good point. I need to get on some sort of diet plan as well. I try for a few days then I get frustrated and quit."
"Setting a goal each day is helpful. Even a little exercise and at least one healthy meal each day helps alot; chicken and rice is my favorite."

"I love that idea of setting smaller daily goals. And I love chicken and rice. "
"I started going to the gym once a week, working up to 4 times a week. I also write down everything I eat. It helps to visually see the progress."

"Yeah I could see that. Kind of like banking. Keeping track of everything so I can hold myself accountable"
"Exactly! Keeping healthy food in the freezer is also good. I make my favorites (chicken and rice!) and freeze it for easy use."

"Another awesome idea! Thanks! Do you have special containers or something to freeze it?"
"I also budget like you! I use freezer ziplock bags so its easy and doesn't take much space. I let them thaw while I'm at the gym or work."

column3:
Hi! I am Mary. I have two children. My oldest son has autism. He is 7 years old and is the light of our life.
Children really give us the opportunity to see they world in a new light. You are so blessed!

Indeed! It is a blessing to have a little human that loves unconditionally. It also gives our family the opportunity to grow by serving.
Yes, I can imagine. Family is one of the most important things in the world to me! Without them, I never would have survived my terrible motorcycle accident.

Wow! You too have your challenges! No one has a perfect life. Like my son, I'm sure you deal with physical and mental therapy to cope.
Yes, My whole left knee is filled with metal. I had to learn to walk all over again. Talk about humbling..

I'm so sorry, but thankful you survived. We all do our best in life. Although my son is not "normal", he too humbles us daily.
Yes, Mary, me too! Having children with developmental disorders is so hard, and unfortunately not everyone is understanding. Blessing to you and your family.

Thankfully there are many services and therapies available to help him and us as supportive parents. The schools have also been very helpful in his progress.
That's amazing. I'll bet that some of the educational treatment works for sure. You are definitely a hero for doing this.

Awareness for autism and support for autistic adults is definitely growing. The people working for this are my heroes!
That is so true! I think social media has helped spread a lot of awareness about how widespread the disorder is.

"I always admire artists, that eye to hand thing is amazing! What does she paint?"

'Nature!! She is not a Rembrand,but she is doing well/'
'I love landscapes. The fall oes especially with the bold reds and oranges.'

"I love that also. I used to do walks with my best friend all the time. But she has moved and I moved, so it's hard."
"It's hard enough keeping friends as an adult in the same city, but living in different places is worse. Thank goodness for social media!"

'Yess!!!!! 30 years ago, you had to call people or write them, waiting for an answer letter a couple of days.'
"I was a teenager when the internet started to go mainstream.... now I have friends that I met online who come to see me."

"I know. I can call my kids in Holland and watch them also same time. Skype."
"I remember when internet phone services came out and they were sooo crappy! But it was the only way I could call my bf at the time"

"Great minds think alike!"

"So you worked at a grocery store also? The one I work at requires me to wear all royal blue. Although blue is my favorite color, its a bit much."
"lol worse.. wal-mart! So I had to wear blue every day too."
"Oh wow! Walmart always advertises for workers and makes it sound like its a great family place to work. I just work at a chain grocery store."
"yeah, no they aren't great for their employees unless you're management. they give out foodstamp applications as part of the hiring packet."
"hmmm. Things are not usually as they seem. Well, in any case, we make money for doing what we do. So I am thankful for the grocery store."
"Truth, enough work! So what do you do for fun?"
"Well, I need to focus on doing things that don't cost a lot so I like to go on walks and listen to audiobooks! How about you."
"I like to kayak on the weekends at the lake near my apartment."

'I work at a school...there is software teachers use to check for plagiarism. Be careful!'
'Yes they can catch that pretty easily now.  I never had much problem with that.  I read all the time'

'I learned my lesson and after that I did really well in school. I always tell students not to procrastinate.'
'That is good advice.  Procrastination is one of my shortcomings.  I was going to work on it but I put it off.'

'Ha! What kinds of things do you like to read?'
'Novels mostly. I have been reading Dickens novels lately.'

'I have not read Dickens since school. I love history and am reading about the Spanish Civil War in the 1930s.'
'The Sun also Rises.  Great Hemingway!  If I am remembering correctly  which I may not be.'

'It is Hemingway and yes you are remembering correctly :-)'
'That's good.  Thanks for the acknowledgement.  I haven't read it in a long time.'

'The book talks about Hemingway reporting on the war and the crazy partying he did with other reporters.'
"That's right.  it's all coming back to me.  Have you read Gore Vidals'  Lincoln?  Great history."

'It makes me realize how lucky we really are. I donated to the red cross but still wish I did more.'
'I donated also! I would have given more if I had gotten the promotion I deserved. I have 10 years experience but another woman got the job.'

"At least you were considered for a promotion. I've been stuck in my position for awhile now."
"True! Just wish I knew why I was passed by. I believe its because she is prettier, peppier and younger."

"If that's the case, you should talk to HR. You could file a suit or get a raise if true."
"Hmmm that's food for thought. I am also struggling in my relationship. My boyfriend of 3 years has asked for an "open" relationship!"

"That's a deal breaker right there. Break up with him!"
"I do think you are right on this one. I just need the confidence to move on - to a new job and a new man!"

"It's tough to make a change like that but it'll be long worth it in the coming weeks."
"Right. Especially when I consider the hurricane victims. I need to make the best of every circumstance. Staying with him is NOT the BEST."

"Maybe take some time off of everything and move to help the victims. Something that helps not only you but others as well."
"Right. Especially when I consider the hurricane victims. I need to make the best of every circumstance. Staying with him is NOT the BEST."

'I will be buying that novel. I work part time so have been writing a little myself.'

'Well I hope it all goes well. You have a creative mind!!'
'Likewise, we must let our thoughts roam after all.'

column3:
"She's very bipolar. Sometimes she goes on these crazy spending binges."
"Bipolar must be difficult. Not knowing which person you are going to get."

"Yeah. I love her, but it's not always easy. Sometimes she's super creative and loves writing. Others shes really depressed and that usually leads to shopping binges."
"Is she on medication for her condition?"

"She is. Sometimes she forgets to take it though. Other times I'm not sure if it works. She does see a Therapist though."
"Maybe it's time to convince her to try a different medication, perhaps? Or meditation?"

"She does meditate from time to time. However, she has a hard time sticking with it."
"Is there some sort of positive reinforcement you could try? Maybe a gift card to spend as she likes when she has not 'binged' for a specified length of time?"

"I  do from time to time. I bring her flowers and try to get her out of the house"
"Is there a better way to control your funds so she can't shop you out of house and home?"

"I hate to do this because she is my wife. But I'm thinking about setting up a separate account."
"I think that's a good idea. I would think she'll understand"

column3:
"She loved to go for walks. I went on many hikes with her that I wouldn't have done by myself."
"I bet she was so happy doing that with you. It sounds like she had a good life and was well loved."

"I live by the ocean and she loved the beach too. And belly rubs! Such a sweet dog, she never hurt any living creature."
"Dogs become part of the family and losing them is so hard. Sometimes all you can do is know that your dog knew she was loved."

"Thank you for understanding that she wasn't "just an animal". Do you have pets?"
"I have a scottish terrier mix. He is black and gray. He sleeps under the covers with me, so he's definitely spoiled. ;-)"

"Oh, sweet! It's so nice to cuddle with a pet when you're sleeping. My dog was too big but my cat sleeps in my arms :)"
"My dog likes to sleep right up next to me. Sometimes his snoring wakes me up. Do you think that one day, you would like another dog?"

"Oh yes, I'll need another dog to keep me hiking and to keep my cat company. They were best friends :/"
"We used to have a cat. Our dog always wanted to play with him. The cat would play...for about thirty seconds. Then he had enough."

"Aw, poor doggie! They always look so sad when someone won't play with them. I hope they were friends otherwise."
"They were. The cat just liked to mess with the dog! You know how cats are, always want to be in control."

"I'd love to make some money walking your dog! How far do you walk him?"
"2 hours every morning. He is young and very playful"

"That would be great, I can do that. $50 per hour sound good?"
"$100 per walk is what you are asking correct? What was your last job?"

"Last job was $50 but I only walked them one hour."
"I assume you are living in a good neighborhood. You give training as well?"

"It's decent, middle class. I'll do my best to get him to sit, roll over and come if I can."
"I wont be able to afford you but can recommend. You have been in this for a while?"

"I've been doing it for about 10 years, off and on."
"Wow I am impressed. How did you end up having free time? People must be in queue for you"

"They are; I've been quite fortunate. I work during the evenings and nights as a bouncer so have lots of day time to spare."
"I am impressed"

column3:
"I can't believe slavery would still exist anywhere in the world."
"It's awful! My husband did a charity organisation to bring awareness and help those who were affected"
"It really is. I know from first hand experience how it is to be a slave. I am so thankful to no longer be in that situation."
"No, I'm so sorry to hear that! It would be rude to ask but when exactly was this?"
"I was a slave for 10 years in Africa. I escaped 5 years ago from Africa with the help of these Christian missionaries."
"Before I met my husband he was also involved in these, however he can't travel due to responsibilities here"
"He was involved in missionaries?"
"Yeah he works at the local Church and he did some work with missionaries. But the little ones don't let him go"
"That is amazing. I owe my freedom to people like him. I definitely understand kids keeping him home now."
"What about yourself? Any significant other? I'm just happy you escaped and started a new life here!"
"Yes, I met my husband here 2 years ago. Thank you. I truly have a great life now. We are hoping to have a child soon."
"Good luck, I think that's fantastic!! Do you think you would adopt, have a surrogate or try donor insemination?"

"G"
'What are you going to do now that the test is over? Feel like going out?'
"Was going to ask if you'd like to do something, I was thinking we could get outside, maybe do some hiking since the weather's still nice."
"I'll be busy through the day for the next few weeks -- but I'm free every evening this week except for Tuesday"
'That sounds even better, maybe go clubbing? what time Tuesday do you want to meet up?'
"I can't Tuesday. Any evening but that one. How about Thursday? They're having a party at Stix"
"OK, then Thursday it is. I'll meet you at Stix."

"I definitely don't have a career in politics! Did the Speech Communications class help?"
"it did . what did you study or do for work ?"

"I'm in medical school. Hoping to be a surgeon someday"
"What field of medicine are you studying?"

"Cardiothoracic Surgery -- heart, lungs, that sort of thing."
"i like going to school but i don't have steady hands so no surgery for me ."

"Both of my parents are doctors. I grew up playing the game "Operation" if you've ever played that -- I was a champ!"
"Yes, but my parents were both clowns so it was really crazy when we got together to play games."

"LOL! We need to introduce them! It wouldn't hurt my parents to lighten up a little bit!"
"They would make me take the train with them to work. People would look at us strange!"

"Hee hee hee... no wonder you were leery of public speaking!"
"I am afraid of clowns now. Still taking the train to work. Do you take the train?"

column3:
"I was drunk and I was scared..."
"Why? You're suppose to support me without wanting anything in return. "
"I'm not talking about the hot-dog situation... I left them there. They were laying on the ground. I don't know if they were okay. "
"Can't you move on? This is serious. My job is on the line. I didn't went to law school all these years for nothing. "
"Habits maybe, I'm not truly sure myself. What should I have done?"
"I don't know if I'm ready to accept the consequences. It is not my first offense. I know it's my fault, but I'm so stressed out."

"That is no excuse! You know how much I love my hot dogs. You took it and Lied about it."
"Don't stress. I forgive you, but you need to buy me some more. "
"Just come clean I know you did it. It is like a scene from my favorite horror novel. "
"You lie about taking my hot dog and you expect me to support you. This really is like my horror novel"
"why what did you do ?"
"I do not even know what to say to you right now. "

"I don't like change, either. Maybe you could try the new backpack out, and keep your old one just in case."
"OK. You know, I would never get rid of my old one. How about you try the new one instead?"

"I could do that. I have a hiking trip planned for next weekend."
"Super. Super. Where are you going?"

"To my vacation home in Pine Mountain Valley. It's near Fort Benning in Georgia. It's great hiking there!"
"Hmmm. I haven't been hiking in Georgia yet. My last hike was near Monte Cristo in Washington State. Whew!"

"Was it a long hike, or just a lot of altitude? I've never been to Washington State, but it looks beautiful in pictures."
"Altitude, for sure. The hike is at least 7 miles. Yeah, it is beautiful. I would like to hike in Georgia sometime."

"It's nice. Pine Mountain Valley is at the foothills of the Smokey Mountains. I can hike the Appalachian trail from there."
"Nothing like Western Washington Cascades, I bet?"

column3:
"Yes! Not gonna lie though, it's a bit stressful. Especially the fact we had to move."
"I can imagine it can be stressful, but all that is behind you now."

"You're right! It's time for celebration, which funny enough is the name of my new town haha! How's your job going?"
"It is going alright I guess. I love what I do, but it can be very stressful."

"Understandable! What do you do when you're stressed out?"
"I love to spend time in nature."

"Oh cool. Do you just relax or like go on hikes?"
"Both. I am a hunter so I spend a lot of time in nature. My family does not eat any store bought meat."

"Can you hunt all year round when you are?"
"There is almost always something in season, but most is in the fall or winter. I usually am able to keep our freezers full throughout the year."

"That's really cool! I wish I could do the same, but I can't get myself to push the trigger in front of an animal."
"Hunting is something passed down in my family. We are Cherokee and only hunt with traditional methods."

I am too forgetful. You must have a great memory. Do you miss your old travel agent job?
Sometimes. It was fun planning trips for other people, and gave me good ideas about where I'd like to go. What destination do you dream about going to?

I really want to go to Novalja, Croatia. Next year, in 2020, they are hosting the Fresh Island rap festival.
How awesome! My father's family is from Croatia and I've always wanted to go there. That sounds amazing!

Really? That is awesome! I hope you do get to go. Do you still have family in Croatia?
Yes, I only know them through Facebook, though. And I love Croatian rap! Fun to watch YouTube videos LOL

That's one thing Facebook is good for. I've found family on several continents that I would have never known about otherwise. Do you miss the UK?

column3:
It is all steak the name is determined from what part of the cow it comes from.
I guess it make sense, yes. I like to eat my steak medium rare. How do you like yours cooked?

I like medium well to well.
Some people would say that you like them overcooked haha!

I have had many people tell me that. I just can't bring myself to eat it any less done.
I can understand, no judgment here! My mom used to cook them well done because she was afraid of food poisoning.

I am not sure of why. I eat duck medium.
Duck steak? So you agree that steak can be mean more than just cow meat?

It can be. I have deer steak in the freezer, but the duck is duck breast.
Did you hunt the deer on your own or just store bought?

I hunt them. My family does not buy meat from a store.
That's pretty cool. You must save money then.

"I've always been interested in criminal justice. My mother was a victim of violent crime once, and I've always wanted to be in law enforcement."
"Sorry to hear about your mother. Good for you! Better job than mine working at Target"

"Target's a great store. I'm glad I've got one so close to home. How long have you worked there?"
"Just started 3 days ago! I get a discount on dog biscuits. I buy my dog one after work every day. But i have a secret! "

"Oh yeah? What's that? You tell me yours and I'll tell you mine"
"The dog treats! I cant help"

"LOL! Some of them do look tempting. My secret: I'm afraid of the dark. I hope they don't figure that out at the police academy!"
"hahahahah. We have that in common! "

"I'll have to give the dog treat thing a try!"
"I can only eat them in the dark! lol"

"LOLOL! That's the funniest thing I've heard all day! I'll have to tell my mom that one. She's really my best friend"
"My dog is not quite my best friend, but she sure does cheer me up a ton!"

I never really ate pizza with meat on it. Since my favorite chicken died in front of my eyes for food, I been off meat forever.
Wow! Someone ate your favorite chicken? That's rough. Did you know it was going to be raised for food before it became your favorite chicken?

No. I never knew any animal was raised for food. I used to think that all meat was from plants. My parents lied to me.
What did you think happened to the animals? So, you ate meat, but you though it came from plants? How long did you believe this?

I believed it until the day my chicken was murdered at the local flower shop..
So why would you want to eat pizza at the flower shop where your chicken was killed? You said it would be nice. That seems odd.

It's to prove to my chicken that I will never eat meat again.
Do you think the chicken would even know? It's dead. Why not just eat your pizza at a pizza shop?

column3:
'Tell me a little bit more about why you feel this way? Was there something that happened recently?'
'Indeed, I got the bad news of my husband doing something behind my back. He met up with another woman!'

'Oh wow, that is not good. What a a jerk! How did you find out?'
'It\'s ironic because one of my grand children told me during our family dinner. She was like "Pops met up with a lady yesterday. They were holding hands!"'

'Oh my did you confront your husband about this? I would be soooo mad!'
"Why yes, I did! The moment he came home from work, I just had to confront him right then n' there."

'That must have taken some courage- and what did "mr. innoncent" have to say for himself? I would have been going into a clinical depression.'
'He kept on playing dumb and acted as if he had no idea what I was rambling on about. I guess you could neither of us slept well that night.'

'of course he did! What do you see as you next step here?'
"I don't want to be a drama queen, but I'd thought of bringing the two of us to a relationship counselor. See if we could work something out."

'That seems ilke a good idea- if only you can get the creep to go.'
"I guess, but for now I'm still trying to figure out what happens next! I'm just very heartbroken by all of this."

column3:
'She likes to spend more time talking to her friends on facebook than spending time with me.'
"Wow, I'm sorry to hear that! I could understand why that may bother you so much."

"Yes, sometimes I feel as though she doesn't value her relationship with me as much as she does with her online friends."
"Yeah, forget about her. If it makes you feel better, you can come to my house and I'll cook for you!"

'LoL. As tempting as that may be, I could not do that to her. We have been together three years already and I do love her.'
"Yeah, sure. But come on... think about it, she obviously doesn't like you as much as you think."

'Maybe. Or does she feel neglected because I work such long hours as a nurse?'
"It's a possibility. Or maybe she's secretly talking to another guy?"

'Well, she does have that one guy friend that she seems pretty chatty with. It does make me wonder.'
'Yeah, you should probably look into that more. She sounds shady.'

'So are you suggesting that I should come right out and ask her? Or should I look at her phone when she is out of the room?'
"I know it sounds bad, but maybe snoop through her phone while she's asleep or something."

'I enjoyed my last game at the YMCA, where do you play?'
'I usually play at our local park. I have a group of friends I meet up with on Friday afternoons.'

'That seems like fun to play outdoors, do you play indoors if it rains or snows?'
"LoL. Well, we have been known to play in my garage if all else fails. I don't use the garage for my car, so it's perfect!"

'Sounds fun! I really want to enter a tournament some day!'
"That would be fun. I'm a competitive person so that sounds like something I would enjoy!"

'You should start playing competitively, and go for the Gold in the Olympics games!'
'Have you ever played in a tournament and won?'

"Not yet, I'm going to sign up for my first one soon!"
'Does your YMCA offer tournaments there?'

"Badminto isn't very popular here therefore I have to go to another location. They really like to play raquetball here by the beach!"
"Raquetball by the beach? I can only imagine how that's possible?! LOL"

"I try to avoid conspiracy theories."

"As a writer, I love them. They can be so mind blowing. Why do you avoid them?"
"Many of them are manufactured to harm the other side and do not follow facts."

"How so?"
"With Trumps Russian collusion the investigation report has come out saying no collusion, but people still believe it."
